quiz.question: Who said "I think, therefore I am" in philosophical writings?
Which suffragist said "Men, their rights and nothing more; women, their rights and nothing less"?
Who wrote "If I had more time, I would have written a shorter letter" about editing prose?
Which explorer wrote about "a new world" after 1492 voyages to the Americas?
Who wrote "The die is cast" after a decisive political military crossing in 49 BCE?
Which medieval saint wrote "Action expresses priorities" in ascetic and ethical guidance?
Which scientist said "Imagination is more important than knowledge"?
Which French general said "I shall return" about the Philippines during WWII?
Who wrote "I prefer dangerous freedom over peaceful slavery" during independence debates?
Who wrote "Give me liberty, or give me death!" in a speech to Virginia delegates?
Which American abolitionist declared "I would unite with anybody to do right and with nobody to do wrong"?
Who wrote "If you want peace, prepare for war" in an ancient military maxim?
Which scientist said "Nothing in life is to be feared, it is only to be understood"?
Which suffragist declared "Failure is impossible" to rally supporters for votes for women?
Who wrote "When the facts change, I change my mind" as a pragmatic economist and historian?
